patterns: What's done with all my information?
responses: We only ask for need to know infomation, which will be kept safe with us
Only the information required for blood donation is made accessible and is kept safe with us

patterns: Is there a way for me to get my nearby requests?
Where can I see blood donation requests near to me?
responses: From the left upper corner menu bar, you can naviagte to the page 'Nearby Request' and get to see all the donation requests available around you
In our app, you also get to see all the blood donation requests made near you by clicking on the dashboard menu on the left upper corner and moving to the nearby requests page

patterns: Which are the blood donation requests nearest to me?
Can I see nearby blood donation requests?
Can I get a list of nearby blood donation requests?
responses: Yes, here is a list of nearby blood donation requests...
Oh!, looks like there are no nearby requests around you, good news of the day!! No one needs blood...YET

patterns: Can my current location be seen all the time?
responses: The blood donators will be able to see the location you put up while posting the request, so that they can check if your near to them
Please be assured, we will not track your location and it will only be visible to blood donors

patterns: What is the purpose of your app?
What is the use of this app?
Why have you started this app?
Why should I use this app?
responses: The main motive behind building this app is to become a bridge between those who desperately need blood and those who are willing to give blood, and help people as much as we can in our own way
Blood is a miracle that can not yet be artifically created but is needed by all, so we aim to serve as a medium and connect people in need
Our app provides various features which makes blood donation easier and efficient and aims to serve people all over as much as possible

patterns: How do I post a blood request?
How should I request for blood?
How will I get blood here?
Where do I navigate to post my blood request?
responses: You can request for blood my moving to the left upper corner of the screen, click on it and you get a dashboard view, there an option 'post request' will be available and you can just go ahead and fill your details and voila,request posted
Please find the menu option in left upper corner and you'll get navigation access of our whole app easily

patterns: Is there a way to see a particular blood request again?
Is there a way to donate blood later on a particular request without loosing it from the home page?
How do I save some requests?
Where do I find my saved requests?
Is there a way to save a particular blood donation request?
responses: On the Home page, you get to see a list of requests for donation. On each request, in right upper corner there is an arrow-like bookmark, after clicking on it your request will be saved for later use
On the left upper corner of the screen, you will get to see a menu bar and by accessing it , 'Saved Requests' option will be visible, where all the requests you have previously saved will be stored
You can swipe the screen from the left side and the navigation dashboard becomes accessible which will guide you to all the pages in our app

patterns: How do I donate blood here?
What do I need to do for donating blood?
Can I donate blood for bloodtype O-
Can I donate blood for bloodtype....
responses: On your home page, you'll get a list of nearby blood requests starting from the top being the requests closest to you

If you are on any other page than the Home page, then you can see the blood donation requests by finding the menu button in the left upper corner and navigating to the Home page, where you'll see all the requests starting from the near to far
For donating blood, you just need to click on the 'DONATE' button on the request visible on the home page and voila, the map will show you the place where blood is needed

patterns: Do I need to consider anything while donating blood?
Are there any precautions I need to follow before donating blood?
Can I donate blood if I have some previous medical history?
responses: Before donating blood, you need to make sure you- 1. Are between 18 to 60 years of age.  2. Weight above 45 kg and are in good health  3. Should not have any STDs. 4. Pregnant women are not eligible to donate blood.

patterns: Is donating blood a painful thing?
Won't blood donation make me weak?
responses: Blood donation is a safe and harmless proccess and the only discomfort might occur when the needle is pricked at first.
Blood donation is a safe process but after donating blood there is a chance of fatigue, dizziness, nausea etc.
Blood donation is a relatively harmless proccess and about 350ml of blood is collected is you weight between 45kg to 55kg or 450ml of blood if you weigh more than 55kg.
